___approvalDate.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

allOf.description: A structured set of questions and their answers. The questions are ordered and grouped into coherent subsets, corresponding to the structure of the grouping of the questionnaire being responded to.

___status.description: The position of the questionnaire response within its overall lifecycle.

___authored.description: The date and/or time that this set of answers were last changed.

___parent.description: A procedure or observation that this questionnaire was performed as part of the execution of.  For example, the surgery a checklist was executed as part of.

___item.description: A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

___subject.description: The subject of the questionnaire response.  This could be a patient, organization, practitioner, device, etc.  This is who/what the answers apply to, but is not necessarily the source of information.

___source.description: The person who answered the questions about the subject.

___basedOn.description: The order, proposal or plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this QuestionnaireResponse.  For example, a ProcedureRequest seeking an intake assessment or a decision support recommendation to assess for post-partum depression.

___questionnaire.description: The Questionnaire that defines and organizes the questions for which answers are being provided.

___identifier.description: A business identifier assigned to a particular completed (or partially completed) questionnaire.

___author.description: Person who received the answers to the questions in the QuestionnaireResponse and recorded them in the system.

___context.description: The encounter or episode of care with primary association to the questionnaire response.

allOf.description: Used to record and send details about a request for referral service or transfer of a patient to the care of another provider or provider organization.

___status.description: The status of the authorization/intention reflected by the referral request record.

___type.description: An indication of the type of referral (or where applicable the type of transfer of care) request.

___serviceRequested.description: The service(s) that is/are requested to be provided to the patient.  For example: cardiac pacemaker insertion.

___occurrenceDateTime.description: The period of time within which the services identified in the referral/transfer of care is specified or required to occur.

___note.description: Comments made about the referral request by any of the participants.

___intent.description: Distinguishes the "level" of authorization/demand implicit in this request.

___description.description: The reason element gives a short description of why the referral is being made, the description expands on this to support a more complete clinical summary.

___recipient.description: The healthcare provider(s) or provider organization(s) who/which is to receive the referral/transfer of care request.

___specialty.description: Indication of the clinical domain or discipline to which the referral or transfer of care request is sent.  For example: Cardiology Gastroenterology Diabetology.

___identifier.description: Business identifier that uniquely identifies the referral/care transfer request instance.

___authoredOn.description: Date/DateTime of creation for draft requests and date of activation for active requests.

___occurrencePeriod.description: The period of time within which the services identified in the referral/transfer of care is specified or required to occur.

___relevantHistory.description: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this resource or fulfilling request or event resources that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the resource.

___replaces.description: Completed or terminated request(s) whose function is taken by this new request.

___definition.description: A protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this request.

___reasonCode.description: Description of clinical condition indicating why referral/transfer of care is requested.  For example:  Pathological Anomalies, Disabled (physical or mental),  Behavioral Management.

___groupIdentifier.description: The business identifier of the logical "grouping" request/order that this referral is a part of.

___supportingInfo.description: Any additional (administrative, financial or clinical) information required to support request for referral or transfer of care.  For example: Presenting problems/chief complaints Medical History Family History Alerts Allergy/Intolerance and Adverse Reactions Medications Observations/Assessments (may include cognitive and fundtional assessments) Diagnostic Reports Care Plan.

___subject.description: The patient who is the subject of a referral or transfer of care request.

___priority.description: An indication of the urgency of referral (or where applicable the type of transfer of care) request.

___basedOn.description: Indicates any plans, proposals or orders that this request is intended to satisfy - in whole or in part.

___reasonReference.description: Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this request.

___requester.description: The individual who initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

___context.description: The encounter at which the request for referral or transfer of care is initiated.

allOf.description: Information about a person that is involved in the care for a patient, but who is not the target of healthcare, nor has a formal responsibility in the care process.

___birthDate.description: The date on which the related person was born.

___period.description: The period of time that this relationship is considered to be valid. If there are no dates defined, then the interval is unknown.

___relationship.description: The nature of the relationship between a patient and the related person.

___gender.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

___patient.description: The patient this person is related to.

___name.description: A name associated with the person.

___active.description: Whether this related person record is in active use.

___address.description: Address where the related person can be contacted or visited.

___identifier.description: Identifier for a person within a particular scope.

___telecom.description: A contact detail for the person, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.

allOf.description: A group of related requests that can be used to capture intended activities that have inter-dependencies such as "give this medication after that one".

___replaces.description: Completed or terminated request(s) whose function is taken by this new request.

___definition.description: A protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this request.

___action.description: The actions, if any, produced by the evaluation of the artifact.

___reasonCodeableConcept.description: Indicates the reason the request group was created. This is typically provided as a parameter to the evaluation and echoed by the service, although for some use cases, such as subscription- or event-based scenarios, it may provide an indication of the cause for the response.

___status.description: The current state of the request. For request groups, the status reflects the status of all the requests in the group.

___groupIdentifier.description: A shared identifier common to all requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the identifier of the requisition, prescription or similar form.

___note.description: Provides a mechanism to communicate additional information about the response.

___intent.description: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the request and where the request fits into the workflow chain.

___subject.description: The subject for which the request group was created.

___priority.description: Indicates how quickly the request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

___basedOn.description: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this request.

___reasonReference.description: Indicates the reason the request group was created. This is typically provided as a parameter to the evaluation and echoed by the service, although for some use cases, such as subscription- or event-based scenarios, it may provide an indication of the cause for the response.

___identifier.description: Allows a service to provide a unique, business identifier for the request.

___author.description: Provides a reference to the author of the request group.

___authoredOn.description: Indicates when the request group was created.

___context.description: Describes the context of the request group, if any.

allOf.description: A process where a researcher or organization plans and then executes a series of steps intended to increase the field of healthcare-related knowledge.  This includes studies of safety, efficacy, comparative effectiveness and other information about medications, devices, therapies and other interventional and investigative techniques.  A ResearchStudy involves the gathering of information about human or animal subjects.

___jurisdiction.description: Indicates a country, state or other region where the study is taking place.

___keyword.description: Key terms to aid in searching for or filtering the study.

___status.description: The current state of the study.

___period.description: Identifies the start date and the expected (or actual, depending on status) end date for the study.

___title.description: A short, descriptive user-friendly label for the study.

___sponsor.description: The organization responsible for the execution of the study.

___note.description: Comments made about the event by the performer, subject or other participants.

___contact.description: Contact details to assist a user in learning more about or engaging with the study.

___reasonStopped.description: A description and/or code explaining the premature termination of the study.

___relatedArtifact.description: Citations, references and other related documents.

___description.description: A full description of how the study is being conducted.

___focus.description: The condition(s), medication(s), food(s), therapy(ies), device(s) or other concerns or interventions that the study is seeking to gain more information about.

___enrollment.description: Reference to a Group that defines the criteria for and quantity of subjects participating in the study.  E.g. " 200 female Europeans between the ages of 20 and 45 with early onset diabetes".

___protocol.description: The set of steps expected to be performed as part of the execution of the study.

___partOf.description: A larger research study of which this particular study is a component or step.

___category.description: Codes categorizing the type of study such as investigational vs. observational, type of blinding, type of randomization, safety vs. efficacy, etc.

___site.description: Clinic, hospital or other healthcare location that is participating in the study.

___identifier.description: Identifiers assigned to this research study by the sponsor or other systems.

___principalInvestigator.description: Indicates the individual who has primary oversite of the execution of the study.

___arm.description: Describes an expected sequence of events for one of the participants of a study.  E.g. Exposure to drug A, wash-out, exposure to drug B, wash-out, follow-up.

allOf.description: A process where a researcher or organization plans and then executes a series of steps intended to increase the field of healthcare-related knowledge.  This includes studies of safety, efficacy, comparative effectiveness and other information about medications, devices, therapies and other interventional and investigative techniques.  A ResearchStudy involves the gathering of information about human or animal subjects.

___assignedArm.description: The name of the arm in the study the subject is expected to follow as part of this study.

___status.description: The current state of the subject.

___consent.description: A record of the patient's informed agreement to participate in the study.

___period.description: The dates the subject began and ended their participation in the study.

___identifier.description: Identifiers assigned to this research study by the sponsor or other systems.

___study.description: Reference to the study the subject is participating in.

___individual.description: The record of the person or animal who is involved in the study.

___actualArm.description: The name of the arm in the study the subject actually followed as part of this study.

allOf.description: This is the base resource type for everything.

___language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

___implicitRules.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.

___id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

___meta.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

allOf.description: An assessment of the likely outcome(s) for a patient or other subject as well as the likelihood of each outcome.

___reasonCodeableConcept.description: The reason the risk assessment was performed.

___status.description: The status of the RiskAssessment, using the same statuses as an Observation.

___parent.description: A reference to a resource that this risk assessment is part of, such as a Procedure.

___occurrenceDateTime.description: The date (and possibly time) the risk assessment was performed.

___condition.description: For assessments or prognosis specific to a particular condition, indicates the condition being assessed.

___method.description: The algorithm, process or mechanism used to evaluate the risk.

___subject.description: The patient or group the risk assessment applies to.

___prediction.description: Describes the expected outcome for the subject.

___basis.description: Indicates the source data considered as part of the assessment (FamilyHistory, Observations, Procedures, Conditions, etc.).

___basedOn.description: A reference to the request that is fulfilled by this risk assessment.

___reasonReference.description: The reason the risk assessment was performed.

___performer.description: The provider or software application that performed the assessment.

___code.description: The type of the risk assessment performed.

___mitigation.description: A description of the steps that might be taken to reduce the identified risk(s).

___identifier.description: Business identifier assigned to the risk assessment.

___comment.description: Additional comments about the risk assessment.

___occurrencePeriod.description: The date (and possibly time) the risk assessment was performed.

___context.description: The encounter where the assessment was performed.

allOf.description: A container for slots of time that may be available for booking appointments.

___planningHorizon.description: The period of time that the slots that are attached to this Schedule resource cover (even if none exist). These  cover the amount of time that an organization's planning horizon; the interval for which they are currently accepting appointments. This does not define a "template" for planning outside these dates.

___active.description: Whether this schedule record is in active use, or should not be used (such as was entered in error).

___actor.description: The resource this Schedule resource is providing availability information for. These are expected to usually be one of HealthcareService, Location, Practitioner, PractitionerRole, Device, Patient or RelatedPerson.

___specialty.description: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment.

___serviceType.description: The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment.

___identifier.description: External Ids for this item.

___comment.description: Comments on the availability to describe any extended information. Such as custom constraints on the slots that may be associated.

___serviceCategory.description: A broad categorisation of the service that is to be performed during this appointment.

allOf.description: Raw data describing a biological sequence.

___type.description: Amino Acid Sequence/ DNA Sequence / RNA Sequence.

___coordinateSystem.description: Whether the sequence is numbered starting at 0 (0-based numbering or coordinates, inclusive start, exclusive end) or starting at 1 (1-based numbering, inclusive start and inclusive end).

___quantity.description: The number of copies of the seqeunce of interest. (RNASeq).

___quality.description: An experimental feature attribute that defines the quality of the feature in a quantitative way, such as a phred quality score ([SO:0001686](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/SO:0001686)).

___pointer.description: Pointer to next atomic sequence which at most contains one variant.

___observedSeq.description: Sequence that was observed. It is the result marked by referenceSeq along with variant records on referenceSeq. This shall starts from referenceSeq.windowStart and end by referenceSeq.windowEnd.

___patient.description: The patient whose sequencing results are described by this resource.

___variant.description: The definition of variant here originates from Sequence ontology ([variant_of](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/variant_of)). This element can represent amino acid or nucleic sequence change(including insertion,deletion,SNP,etc.)  It can represent some complex mutation or segment variation with the assist of CIGAR string.

___referenceSeq.description: A sequence that is used as a reference to describe variants that are present in a sequence analyzed.

___performer.description: The organization or lab that should be responsible for this result.

___repository.description: Configurations of the external repository. The repository shall store target's observedSeq or records related with target's observedSeq.

___identifier.description: A unique identifier for this particular sequence instance. This is a FHIR-defined id.

___device.description: The method for sequencing, for example, chip information.

___readCoverage.description: Coverage (read depth or depth) is the average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence.

allOf.description: A slot of time on a schedule that may be available for booking appointments.

___status.description: busy | free | busy-unavailable | busy-tentative | entered-in-error.

___start.description: Date/Time that the slot is to begin.

___overbooked.description: This slot has already been overbooked, appointments are unlikely to be accepted for this time.

___specialty.description: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment.

___serviceType.description: The type of appointments that can be booked into this slot (ideally this would be an identifiable service - which is at a location, rather than the location itself). If provided then this overrides the value provided on the availability resource.

___identifier.description: External Ids for this item.

___comment.description: Comments on the slot to describe any extended information. Such as custom constraints on the slot.

___appointmentType.description: The style of appointment or patient that may be booked in the slot (not service type).

___schedule.description: The schedule resource that this slot defines an interval of status information.

___serviceCategory.description: A broad categorisation of the service that is to be performed during this appointment.

___end.description: Date/Time that the slot is to conclude.

allOf.description: A sample to be used for analysis.

___status.description: The availability of the specimen.

___type.description: The kind of material that forms the specimen.

___processing.description: Details concerning processing and processing steps for the specimen.

___parent.description: Reference to the parent (source) specimen which is used when the specimen was either derived from or a component of another specimen.

___note.description: To communicate any details or issues about the specimen or during the specimen collection. (for example: broken vial, sent with patient, frozen).

___subject.description: Where the specimen came from. This may be from the patient(s) or from the environment or a device.

___container.description: The container holding the specimen.  The recursive nature of containers; i.e. blood in tube in tray in rack is not addressed here.

___accessionIdentifier.description: The identifier assigned by the lab when accessioning specimen(s). This is not necessarily the same as the specimen identifier, depending on local lab procedures.

___request.description: Details concerning a test or procedure request that required a specimen to be collected.

___identifier.description: Id for specimen.

___receivedTime.description: Time when specimen was received for processing or testing.

___type.description: The type this structure describes. If the derivation kind is 'specialization' then this is the master definition for a type, and there is always one of these (a data type, an extension, a resource, including abstract ones). Otherwise the structure definition is a constraint on the stated type (and in this case, the type cannot be an abstract type).

___baseDefinition.description: An absolute URI that is the base structure from which this type is derived, either by specialization or constraint.

___mapping.description: An external specification that the content is mapped to.

___version.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the structure definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the structure definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

___date.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the structure definition was published. The date must change if and when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the structure definition changes.

___experimental.description: A boolean value to indicate that this structure definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

___fhirVersion.description: The version of the FHIR specification on which this StructureDefinition is based - this is the formal version of the specification, without the revision number, e.g. [publication].[major].[minor], which is 3.0.1 for this version.

___kind.description: Defines the kind of structure that this definition is describing.

___abstract.description: Whether structure this definition describes is abstract or not  - that is, whether the structure is not intended to be instantiated. For Resources and Data types, abstract types will never be exchanged  between systems.

___name.description: A natural language name identifying the structure definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

___differential.description: A differential view is expressed relative to the base StructureDefinition - a statement of differences that it applies.

___copyright.description: A copyright statement relating to the structure definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the structure definition.

allOf.description: The subscription resource is used to define a push based subscription from a server to another system. Once a subscription is registered with the server, the server checks every resource that is created or updated, and if the resource matches the given criteria, it sends a message on the defined "channel" so that another system is able to take an appropriate action.

___criteria.description: The rules that the server should use to determine when to generate notifications for this subscription.

___status.description: The status of the subscription, which marks the server state for managing the subscription.

___channel.description: Details where to send notifications when resources are received that meet the criteria.

___reason.description: A description of why this subscription is defined.

___error.description: A record of the last error that occurred when the server processed a notification.

___contact.description: Contact details for a human to contact about the subscription. The primary use of this for system administrator troubleshooting.

___end.description: The time for the server to turn the subscription off.

___tag.description: A tag to add to any resource that matches the criteria, after the subscription is processed.

allOf.description: A homogeneous material with a definite composition.

___description.description: A description of the substance - its appearance, handling requirements, and other usage notes.

___status.description: A code to indicate if the substance is actively used.

___code.description: A code (or set of codes) that identify this substance.

___category.description: A code that classifies the general type of substance.  This is used  for searching, sorting and display purposes.

___identifier.description: Unique identifier for the substance.

___ingredient.description: A substance can be composed of other substances.

___instance.description: Substance may be used to describe a kind of substance, or a specific package/container of the substance: an instance.

allOf.description: Record of delivery of what is supplied.

___status.description: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.

___type.description: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

___occurrenceDateTime.description: The date or time(s) the activity occurred.

___supplier.description: The individual responsible for dispensing the medication, supplier or device.

___occurrenceTiming.description: The date or time(s) the activity occurred.

___patient.description: A link to a resource representing the person whom the delivered item is for.

___destination.description: Identification of the facility/location where the Supply was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.

___basedOn.description: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

___partOf.description: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.

___suppliedItem.description: The item that is being delivered or has been supplied.

___identifier.description: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility when the item(s) is dispensed.

___occurrencePeriod.description: The date or time(s) the activity occurred.

___receiver.description: Identifies the person who picked up the Supply.

allOf.description: A record of a request for a medication, substance or device used in the healthcare setting.

___reasonCodeableConcept.description: Why the supply item was requested.

___status.description: Status of the supply request.

___occurrenceDateTime.description: When the request should be fulfilled.

___supplier.description: Who is intended to fulfill the request.

___occurrenceTiming.description: When the request should be fulfilled.

___priority.description: Indicates how quickly this SupplyRequest should be addressed with respect to other requests.

___reasonReference.description: Why the supply item was requested.

___deliverFrom.description: Where the supply is expected to come from.

___requester.description: The individual who initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

___category.description: Category of supply, e.g.  central, non-stock, etc. This is used to support work flows associated with the supply process.

___identifier.description: Unique identifier for this supply request.

___deliverTo.description: Where the supply is destined to go.

___occurrencePeriod.description: When the request should be fulfilled.

allOf.description: A task to be performed.

___status.description: The current status of the task.

___definitionReference.description: A reference to a formal or informal definition of the task.  For example, a protocol, a step within a defined workflow definition, etc.

___definitionUri.description: A reference to a formal or informal definition of the task.  For example, a protocol, a step within a defined workflow definition, etc.

___statusReason.description: An explanation as to why this task is held, failed, was refused, etc.

___note.description: Free-text information captured about the task as it progresses.

___intent.description: Indicates the "level" of actionability associated with the Task.  I.e. Is this a proposed task, a planned task, an actionable task, etc.

___description.description: A free-text description of what is to be performed.

___focus.description: The request being actioned or the resource being manipulated by this task.

___code.description: A name or code (or both) briefly describing what the task involves.

___identifier.description: The business identifier for this task.

___authoredOn.description: The date and time this task was created.

___businessStatus.description: Contains business-specific nuances of the business state.

___relevantHistory.description: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this Task that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the task.

___restriction.description: If the Task.focus is a request resource and the task is seeking fulfillment (i.e is asking for the request to be actioned), this element identifies any limitations on what parts of the referenced request should be actioned.

___lastModified.description: The date and time of last modification to this task.

___reason.description: A description or code indicating why this task needs to be performed.

___performerType.description: The type of participant that can execute the task.

___for.description: The entity who benefits from the performance of the service specified in the task (e.g., the patient).

___executionPeriod.description: Identifies the time action was first taken against the task (start) and/or the time final action was taken against the task prior to marking it as completed (end).

___groupIdentifier.description: An identifier that links together multiple tasks and other requests that were created in the same context.

___priority.description: Indicates how quickly the Task should be addressed with respect to other requests.

___basedOn.description: BasedOn refers to a higher-level authorization that triggered the creation of the task.  It references a "request" resource such as a ProcedureRequest, MedicationRequest, ProcedureRequest, CarePlan, etc. which is distinct from the "request" resource the task is seeking to fulfil.  This latter resource is referenced by FocusOn.  For example, based on a ProcedureRequest (= BasedOn), a task is created to fulfil a procedureRequest ( = FocusOn ) to collect a specimen from a patient.

___partOf.description: Task that this particular task is part of.

___owner.description: Individual organization or Device currently responsible for task execution.

___input.description: Additional information that may be needed in the execution of the task.

___context.description: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this task was created.

allOf.description: A summary of information based on the results of executing a TestScript.

___tester.description: Name of the tester producing this report (Organization or individual).

___status.description: The current state of this test report.

___participant.description: A participant in the test execution, either the execution engine, a client, or a server.

___testScript.description: Ideally this is an absolute URL that is used to identify the version-specific TestScript that was executed, matching the `TestScript.url`.

___test.description: A test executed from the test script.

___score.description: The final score (percentage of tests passed) resulting from the execution of the TestScript.

___result.description: The overall result from the execution of the TestScript.

___name.description: A free text natural language name identifying the executed TestScript.

___issued.description: When the TestScript was executed and this TestReport was generated.

___identifier.description: Identifier for the TestScript assigned for external purposes outside the context of FHIR.

___teardown.description: The results of the series of operations required to clean up after the all the tests were executed (successfully or otherwise).

___setup.description: The results of the series of required setup operations before the tests were executed.

___ruleset.description: Contains one or more rules.  Offers a way to group rules so assertions could reference the group of rules and have them all applied.

___fixture.description: Fixture in the test script - by reference (uri). All fixtures are required for the test script to execute.

___rule.description: Assert rule to be used in one or more asserts within the test script.

___title.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the test script.

___publisher.description: The name of the individual or organization that published the test script.

___profile.description: Reference to the profile to be used for validation.

allOf.description: A value set specifies a set of codes drawn from one or more code systems.

___status.description: The status of this value set. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

___title.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the value set.

___publisher.description: The name of the individual or organization that published the value set.

___description.description: A free text natural language description of the value set from a consumer's perspective.

___version.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the value set when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. ___purpose.description: Explaination of why this value set is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

___compose.description: A set of criteria that define the content logical definition of the value set by including or excluding codes from outside this value set. This I also known as the "Content Logical Definition" (CLD).

___name.description: A natural language name identifying the value set. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

___copyright.description: A copyright statement relating to the value set and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the value set.

allOf.description: An authorization for the supply of glasses and/or contact lenses to a patient.

___encounter.description: A link to a resource that identifies the particular occurrence of contact between patient and health care provider.

___reasonCodeableConcept.description: Can be the reason or the indication for writing the prescription.

___status.description: The status of the resource instance.

___reasonReference.description: Can be the reason or the indication for writing the prescription.

___dispense.description: Deals with details of the dispense part of the supply specification.

___identifier.description: Business identifier which may be used by other parties to reference or identify the prescription.

___dateWritten.description: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was written.

___prescriber.description: The healthcare professional responsible for authorizing the prescription.

___patient.description: A link to a resource representing the person to whom the vision products will be supplied.
